NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. in a way that appears to be true but may in fact not be 似乎，表面上地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He remains confident and seemingly untroubled by our recent problems.
e.g. The water is quite shallow for some distance.
e.g. Rome has been called the Eternal City.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. (overtook, overtaken) catch up to and pass 赶上，超过
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. After only two years in the American market, our US sales have now overtaken our sales in Europe.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. likely to happen soon 即将来临的，逼近的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. According to the weather report a rainstorm is imminent.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an act or instance of imitating 模仿，效法
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She can do a wonderful imitation of a blackbird's song.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. producing a strong or clear impression on the senses 生动的，清晰的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She gave the police a vivid description of the accident.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. producing goods, crops, or wealth 生产的，多产的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They work hard, but their efforts are not very productive.

NewWords.WordPhrase: find by accident; come across 偶然发现；突然遇见
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I came upon this book in the attic. Would you like it?

NewWords.WordPhrase: by a single action 一举，一下子
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They threatened to cancel the whole project at one stroke.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. from another part of the world; foreign 外来的；外国的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There's an exhibition of exotic houseplants.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. limitless, never-ending 无限的，无穷的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Listening to the late quartets on that little gramophone, I experienced the most infinite musical joy that I had ever known.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. doing or saying the same thing again 重复
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I want no repetition of your bad behavior.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be in the habit of doing 习惯
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He's given to taking long walks.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. call or send for 召唤，传唤
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He summoned up a smile, though it seemed to take all his strength.

NewWords.WordPhrase: hit and crush under a vehicle （车等）碾过
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She was run over and killed by a train.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a building, etc. built in memory of a person or historical event 纪念碑
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This pillar is a monument to all those who died in the civil war.
